channel.title: nodejs on Jonathan Goldfarb
channel.description: Recent content in nodejs on Jonathan Goldfarb

item.title: How To Make Sense of the NodeJS Event Loop
item.description: When you’re writing JavaScript code for NodeJS, you don’t often need to think about how your code will be executed. You may be thinking about the models you are working with, how data moves through your application, or what guarantees you need to be able to provide to meet your acceptance criteria - or you may have another framework in mind. One of the great things about JavaScript on the Node runtime as a developer is that you get to write code at a high level and have your code execute efficiently on hardware.
